result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Hannah L. Novy
Current: 1900 Nebraska St., Lot 35, Muscoda, WI 53573 United States  (Effective: 10-27-2015)
Prior: 1900 E. Nebraska Street #35, Muscoda, WI 53573
Dismissed/read-in as part of the disposition this date in 14CM98 and 15CM45.  Minutes taken in those cases.

4 cases called together for status:  14CT38, 15CM67, 15CM45, and 14CM98.  Defendant Hannah L. Novy not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney David E Saperstein in court, by authorization, for Defendant Hannah L. Novy.  Atty. S states that the parties have reached a resolution; proposed agreement includes plea to both 2nd and 3rd OWI; as there will be an immediate report date, def wants to be able to make arrangements with employment.  Court sets for Oct. 27 at 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Hannah L. Novy not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney David E Saperstein in court, by authorization, for Defendant Hannah L. Novy.  Several cases called together for status:  15CM45, 14CT38, 14CM98, and 15CM67.  Atty. Saperstein requests further status.  So ordered.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

14CT38, 15CM67, 14CM98, and 15CM45.  Defendant Hannah L. Novy not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney David E Saperstein in court for Defendant Hannah L. Novy.  Atty. Saperstein files authorizations to appear and requests additional status scheduling; states parties are working towards resolution; states discovery is not complete for the most recent case.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath, or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance.  Defendant is not to enter into any bars/taverns or establishment where the sale of alcohol is the primary business.  Regarding curfew, the Court has imposed a curfew, during which Defendant must be at her residence, from midnight to 6 a.m. (This is a change from the previous bond in this matter.)

Defendant Hannah L. Novy in court with attorney David E Saperstein. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance conducted in 15CM67 and status in 14CM45, 14CM98, and 14CT38.  NG pleas have been entered in all matters.  Atty. Saperstein addresses Court re bond curfew conditions in 15CM67; asks for elimination or tayloring of that condition due to def's work schedule.  Court notes that def was agreeable to those conditions at the time of the bail hrg.  Atty. S suggests def be in her home from midnight to 6 a.m.  ADA doesn't object but cautions def to ensure she honors the deal.  Court makes amendment to bond to change curfew to midnight-6 a.m.

All matters set for status June 24th at 3:30 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
